It all began with the Lipman postal card in 1861 Ã¢â‚¬â€ "half the price of paper and  envelopes and ready for instant dispatch." Then there were the souvenir cards sold at the World's Columbian Exposition in Chicago in 1893. So began a craze that was to reach enormous heights by 1905: "The demand for illustrated postal cards is daily  assuming larger proportions and there are no prospects of the slightest abatement anywhere in sight." (Dry Goods Reporter, November 1905)
